$path.description: The API path for the resource

auxReference.description:
Auxiliary reference. Used for German "Kreditorennummer" and "Debitorennummer".
See Datev Settings endpoint reference

auxiliaryAccount.description:
Auxiliary account - used when auxiliary accounting is enabled in business settings.
Available only in Spain and France

bankAccountDetails.description: The account details for the contact's bank account

cisRegistered.description:
Identifies a contact as being registered as CIS.
only applicable to UK business

cisSettings.description: The CIS Settings for the contact

deduction_rate.description: The CIS Deduction rate for the contact

$path.description: The API path for the resource

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

registered_cis_name.description: the CIS name for the Contact

subcontractor_verification_number.description: The CIS Verification number for the contact

contactTypes.description: The type of the contact. It has to be either CUSTOMER or VENDOR

$path.description: The API path for the resource

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

createdAt.description: The datetime when the item was created

creditDays.description:
Custom credit days for the contact.
If returned as null in a GET response, you may want to GET /invoice_settings and use 'customer_credit_days'/'vendor_credit_days' as default/fallback according to your use case.

creditLimit.description:
Custom credit limit amount for the contact
not applicable to Start

creditTerms.description:
Credit terms options determine how invoice due dates are calculated.
Options include: end of next month, a delay of supplier credit_days and immediately.
Only: month_end_invoice, date_from_invoice, immediate_invoice, month_end_payment,
date_from_payment, immediate_payment are valid values.
If returned as null in a GET response, you may want to GET /invoice_settings
and use 'customer_credit_terms'/'vendor_credit_terms' as default.

creditTermsAndConditions.description:
Custom terms and conditions for the contact. If set will override global /invoice_settings default terms and conditions.
Customers only

currency.description:
The currency that the contact trades in
not applicable to Start

$path.description: The API path for the resource

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

defaultPurchaseLedgerAccount.description:
The default purchase ledger account for the contact
Vendors only

$path.description: The API path for the resource

balanceDetails.description: The ledger account balance details for the date range provided

creditOrDebit.description: Is the balance a debit or credit

cisLabour.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is flagged for CIS Labour

cisMaterials.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is flagged for CIS Materials

controlName.description:
The control name for the ledger account.

This is used internally by Accounting to identify the correct ledger account for booking taxes etc.
You cannot add ledger accounts with control name and you cannot modify the control name of existing
ledger accounts.

createdAt.description: The datetime when the item was created

displayFormatted.description: The display name formatted based on coa_list_order in settings

displayName.description: The display name for the ledger account

fixedTaxRate.description: Indicates whether the default tax rate is fixed or may be changed per transaction

gifiCode.description:
The GIFI code of the ledger account.

GIFI is short for The General Index of Financial Information and it lets the CRA validate tax information electronically instead of manually.
Information from financial statements is categorized under the appropriate 4-digit-long GIFI code and entered on corporate income tax returns.
GIFI is needed when filing a T2 income tax return.

_Canada only_

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

includedInChart.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is included in the chart of accounts

isControlAccount.description:
Indicates whether the ledger account is a control account.

Control accounts cannot be removed. See also `control_name`.

ledgerAccountClassification.description: The ledger account classification for the ledger account

$path.description: The API path for the resource

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

ledgerAccountGroup.description: The ledger account group for the account

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

ledgerAccountType.description: The ledger account type for the ledger account

$path.description: The API path for the resource

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

name.description:
The name for the ledger account.

Changes to this field do not propagate to other resources, namely not to the name of the associated
bank_account (unlike the behaviour of the UI).

nominalCode.description: The nominal code of the ledger account

recoverablePercentage.description: The partial recoverable tax rate (Canada only)

taxInstalment.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is flagged for Tax Intalment (Canada only)

taxRate.description: The default tax rate for the ledger account

$path.description: The API path for the resource

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

taxRecoverable.description: Indicates that transactions posted to this ledger account have part recoverable taxes (Canada only)

updatedAt.description: The datetime when the item was last updated

visibleInBanking.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the banking area of the application

visibleInExpenses.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the purchases area of the application

visibleInJournals.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the journals area of the application

visibleInOtherPayments.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the other payments area of the application

visibleInOtherReceipts.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the other receipts area of the application

visibleInReporting.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the reporting area of the application

visibleInSales.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the sales area of the application

visibleScopes.description:
The visible scopes for the ledger account.

This indicates in which of the UI's areas the ledger account is displayed and available for user
selection. Possible entries in this array are `bank`, `sales`, `purchasing`, `other_payment`,
`other_receipt`, `reporting`, `journals`, `sales_eu`, `sales_row`, `purchasing_eu`, `purchasing_row`
and `purchasing_hrc`.

defaultSalesLedgerAccount.description:
The default sales ledger account for the contact
Customers only

defaultSalesTaxRate.description:
The default sales tax rate for the contact
Customers only

$path.description: The API path for the resource

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

deletable.description: Indicates whether the contact can be deleted successfully

deletedAt.description: The datetime when the item was deleted

$path.description: The API path for the resource

addressLine_1.description: The first line of the address

addressLine_2.description: The second line of the address

addressType.description:
Defines the nature of the address (Shipping, Billing, Head Office etc.).
Start defaults to "Sales" for Customers and "Purchasing" for Vendors

$path.description: The API path for the resource

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

bankAccount.description: The related bank account of the address, if the address belongs to a bank account.

$path.description: The API path for the resource

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

contact.description: The related contact of the address, if the address belongs to a contact.

$path.description: The API path for the resource

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

$path.description: The API path for the resource

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

countryGroup.description:
Country group allows countries to be filtered for selection.
Set it to e.g. EU if the address is within the EEC.

$path.description: The API path for the resource

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

createdAt.description: The datetime when the item was created

deletedAt.description: The datetime when the item was deleted

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

isMainAddress.description: Specifies the address as the contact's main address. Only a single address can exist for a contact in Start so this is always true when returned by the API but cannot be seen in the UI

name.description: The custom name of the address

updatedAt.description: The datetime when the item was last updated

destinationVatBlocking.description: Identifies a contact should be blocked due to destination vat

email.description: The email address for the given contact

gbBased.description: Identifies a contact as being based in Great Britain.

gdprObfuscated.description: General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) came into effect on 25th May 2018. It introduces new rules for how business owners manage their contacts' personal data. When this field returns 'true', means that the contact has been requested to be obfuscated and you can not create any artifact (sales invoices, purchase invoices, ...) but you can still check previously created artifacts.

hasUnfinishedRecurringInvoices.description: Indicates whether the contact is associated with any unfinished recurring invoices

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

isActive.description: Identifies a contact as being active

rel.description: The relationship of the link to the resource

mainAddress.description: The main address associated with the contact

address.description: The address of the contact person

contactPersonTypes.description: The contact person types for the contact person. Get possible types by retrieving all available contact person types .

$path.description: The API path for the resource

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

createdAt.description: The datetime when the item was created

deletedAt.description: The datetime when the item was deleted

email.description: The email address of the contact person

fax.description: The fax number of the contact person

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

isMainContact.description: Indicates whether this is the main contact person. Per contact, only one main contact can be selected.

isPreferredContact.description: Indicates whether this contact person is a preferred contact

jobTitle.description: The job title of the contact person

mobile.description: The mobile number of the contact person

name.description: The name of the contact person

telephone.description: The telephone number of the contact person

updatedAt.description: The datetime when the item was last updated

name.description: The contact's full name or business name

niBased.description: Identifies a contact as being based in Northern Ireland.

productSalesPriceType.description:
All default product_sales_price_type defaults. Learn more about sales price types
Customers only, not applicable to Start

$path.description: The API path for the resource

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

reference.description:
Auxiliary reference. Used for German "Kreditorennummer" and "Debitorennummer".
See Datev Settings endpoint reference

registeredNumber.description: The registered number of the contact's business. Only used for German businesses and represents the "Steuernummer" there (not the "USt-ID").

sourceGuid.description: Used when importing contacts from external sources

system.description: Identifies a contact as being a system contact used for processing specific transaction types and reserved specifically for those transaction types such as tax return payments/refunds.

taxCalculation.description:
France: The tax calculation method used to define tax treatment Vendors only
Spain: Defines if contact is a retailer and tax is subject to Recargo de Equivalencia Customers only United Kingdom: Defines if contact tax treatment is domestic reverse charge Customers & Suppliers

taxNumber.description: The VAT registration number of the contact. The format will be validated.

taxTreatment.description: The tax treatment - indicates which tax rules to apply for a contact

euNotTaxRegistered.description: Indicates an EU contact without a tax number - home tax rules should be applied

euTaxRegistered.description: Indicates a contact where EC tax rules should be applied

homeTax.description: Indicates a contact where home country tax rules should be applied

isImporter.description: Indicates a contact where import rules should be appliedOnly used for suppliers and FR, ES, IE and UK businesses

restOfWorldTax.description: Indicates a contact where rest of world tax rules should be applied

updatedAt.description: The datetime when the item was last updated
